subject: Re: [junit] Re: Methods that does not return value
msgSnippet: ... You need com.ibm.uvm.tools.DebugSupport on your classpath.  When you export your code make sure to export the jar with that class as well. JUnit was not
messageBody:
On Wed, 2003-06-18 at 17:52, ok_lilya wrote:

> I've been stuck on this problem way too long - There must be somekind
> of solution to it! Unless JUnit is designed specifically to avoid
> being run outside of VAJ. I'm on the verge of giving up.

You need 'com.ibm.uvm.tools.DebugSupport' on your classpath. When you
export your code make sure to export the jar with that class as well.
JUnit was not written to specifically run in VAJ. So, that isn't the
problem!! Look at the JavaDoc for LinkageError, it will give you a clue
as to why it is thrown. The JavaDoc probably would have been sufficient
to let you know that it was a classpath issue.

=jason
